response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<DataSnapshot> it = dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
  i = i + 1;
    names.add(it.next().getValue(String.class));
}
<<<explanation>>>: You're creating a new dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator() in every iteration of your loop. Try to just use the value of the foreach inside the loop.
Question: How to get the value of a key in a JSONObject:I have a JSONObject and i want to get the value of a key in it.
Please using this api: JSONObject.get(String).
Answer:<<<api>>>: JSONObject.get(String)
<<<code>>>: JSONObject jsonObject = new JSONObject(jsonString);
String key = "key";
String value = jsonObject.get(key);
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the get method to get the value of a key in a JSONObject.
Question: How to get the value of a key in a JSONArray:I have a JSONArray and i want to get the value of a key in it.
Please using this api: JSONArray.get(int).
Answer:<<<api>>>: JSONArray.get(int)
<<<code>>>: JSONArray jsonArray = new JSONArray(jsonString);
int index = 0;
String key = "key";
String value = jsonArray.get(index);
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the get method to get the value of a key in a JSONArray.
